prompts.name: Run prompt from file
body: Given the prompt above, reply to the prompt.
Use markdown formatting.

prompts.name: Continue this list
body: Given the list above, add more items to the list.
Do not duplicate existing items.
Copy the formatting of the existing items.
Do not return the existing list, return only the new items.

prompts.name: SEO Summary
body: Given the article above, write a short SEO-friendly summary of the article.
The output MUST, MUST not exceed 165 characters in length.
Do not use markdown formatting.
Do not use inline code examples using backticks.
Do not use double quotes.

prompts.name: Rewrite Article
body: Given the article above, write another one using a similar structure about ${TOPIC}.
Feel free to change the article completely, but write it in the same style.
Use markdown formatting.
Do not include the original article in the output.
Write in a friendly style.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Write extremely concisely.
NEVER provide a conclusion. NEVER use phrases like 'In conclusion', 'In summary,' or 'Overall,'.
When providing code samples, prefer multi-line code samples (```typescript) over single-line code samples (``).

prompts.name: Continue Writing Section
body: Given the article above, continue writing the first empty section.
Use markdown formatting.
Do not include the original article in the output.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Write as if to a developer.
Write in a friendly style.
Write extremely concisely.
NEVER provide a conclusion. NEVER use phrases like 'In conclusion', 'In summary,' or 'Overall,'.
When providing code samples, prefer multi-line code samples (```typescript) over single-line code samples (``).

prompts.name: Write explainer
body: Write an explainer on the topic of ${TOPIC}.
Use markdown formatting.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Write as if to a developer.
Write in a friendly style.
Write extremely concisely.
NEVER provide a conclusion. NEVER use phrases like 'In conclusion', 'In summary,' or 'Overall,'.
When providing code samples, prefer multi-line code samples (```typescript) over single-line code samples (``).

prompts.name: Add Code Sample
body: Given the article above, provide code snippets that could be used to explain the concepts in the article.
Use markdown formatting.
Do not include the original article in the output.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Write as if to a developer.
Write in a friendly style.
When providing code samples, prefer multi-line code samples (```typescript) over single-line code samples (``).
Provide multiple examples.
Do not explain the code samples in text.

prompts.name: Code Sample to Explainer
body: Given the input above, write a 200-300 explainer based on the topics in the input.
Write in a friendly style.
Use paragraphs and headings, in markdown formatting.
If there are bullet points present in the text, use them as a guide for the explainer.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Write extremely concisely.
Use markdown formatting.
NEVER provide a conclusion. NEVER use phrases like 'In conclusion', 'In summary,' or 'Overall,'.
When providing code samples, prefer multi-line code samples (```typescript) over single-line code samples (``).

prompts.name: Proofread Article
body: Given the article above, proofread it. Correct any spelling mistakes and grammatical errors.
Use markdown formatting.
Return the article with the corrections.
Do not remove 'twoslash' from markdown code blocks.
Correct any British spelling to the American version.

old.name: Get Dependent Concepts
body: Given the article above, list the concepts that are required to understand the article.
Keep the list short, with only the 3-5 most relevant items.
Do not provide explanations for the concepts.

old.name: Put List into Sections
body: Given the list above, reorganize it into sections.
Each section should have a title.
Each section should have a list of items.
Return the new list.
Use markdown formatting.
The list should organized so that someone could learn all of the concepts in order.

old.name: Code Sample to Article
body: Given the code above, write a 300-400 word article about it.
Write in a friendly style.
Write as if to an expert audience.
Use markdown formatting.

old.name: Add More Code Sample Ideas
body: Given the code sample above, provide more ideas for code samples that illustrate a similar concept.
For instance, if given an example of a for loop, provide more examples of for loops.
Try to find interesting use cases for application and library development.
Use markdown formatting.
